The Special Counsel’s thorough investigation lasted nearly two years cost taxpayers more than $25 million and resulted in more than 2800 subpoenas and nearly 500 executed search warrants yet Democrats refuse to accept the report's conclusion.

Further while the Special Counsel decided to follow the Office of Legal Counsel’s opinion regarding charging a sitting president with a crime he was not prevented by statute from suggesting that President Trump’s conduct rose to the level of an impeachable offense. He did not.

Ultimately he concluded in his report that there was insufficient evidence to prove that the President or his staff engaged in criminal conspiracy with the Russian government to influence our presidential election.
Therefore it was not Special Counsel Robert Mueller’s job to exonerate the President but rather to determine whether there was or was not sufficient evidence to show the President committed a crime.
